## Feature 1 - Add a new Task
- Add a new Task to current TaskList.
- Command to add ToDo Task: todo {DESCRIPTION}
- Command to add Deadline Task: deadline {DESCRIPTION} /by {DUE_DATE}
- Command to add Event Task: event {DESCRIPTION} /from {START_TIME /to {END_TIME}
- Command to add FixedDuration Task: fixedduration {DESCRIPTION} /needs {DURATION}
- Delete the Task of given index
## Feature 3 - Mark a Task as done
- Mark the Task of given index as done
## Feature 4 - Unmark a Task to not done
- Unmark the Task of given index to not done
## Feature 5 - Find Task by keyword
- Find Tasks including given keywords in description
## Feature 7 - Save TaskList to hard disk
- Damon will automatically save TaskList in "Damon.txt" file and update the file once you change the TaskList. You may change the storage path in **iP\src\main\java\damon\gui\Main.java**, i.e.,
private Damon damon = new Damon("put your storage path here!");
super("Sorry, I cant understand what you mean. Maybe you can change your input format.");
super("Pls add deadline for this task. Thank u! :)");
super("Pls add description and deadline of this task, thank u! :)");
super("Pls only add one deadline for this task! :)");
* Creates a chatbot called Damon. A Damon object responds to user's input
* by adding, deleting, marking, and un-marking Tasks in TaskList object.
* Damon also store Tasks in TaskList in storage file of its filepath using Storage object.
* Constructs a new Damon object with String filePath parameter.
* @param filePath Path of storage file of this Damon object.
* Runs chatbot Damon according to user's input.
* Returns Damon object's status of whether to exit.
* Returns Damon object's response message to user's input.
* @return responseMessage of Response object in Damon object.
